tasks.title: Measure 3 â€“ Identify the characteristics of the denial of service
tasks.description:
### ğŸ¯ Objective

Describe **vectors**, **targets**, and **intensity**.

---

### ğŸ“Œ Actions (cf. reflex sheet)

* General assessment

  * How many attack waves were observed and what was their duration?
  * What metrics are observable from equipment logs or consoles?

    * Volume (Mb/s)
    * If observed volumes exceed bandwidth capacity: Category \[Volumetric]
    * Packets per second (pps)
    * Connections per second
* Assessment based on the traffic chain

  * Determine the denial-of-service type by identifying the number of source IPs of the requests

    * Single? (Type: \[Denial of Service (DoS)])
    * Multiple? (Type: \[Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS)])
    * Massively multiple? (Type: \[Highly Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS)])
  * Origin of the requests:

    * Single IP?
    * Specific IP ranges?
    * Specific AS?
    * Specific geographic areas
    * Anonymization networks (Tor, VPN)
    * Malicious infrastructures (botnets)
    * VPS/IaaS subnets
    * Legitimate infrastructure, proxy, or exposed API â†’ reflection or amplification attack
    * Spoofed source IPs (e.g. UDP):

      * Spoofing targeting another victim â†’ reflection/amplification from our infrastructures
      * Private IPs (RFC1918)
      * Null or invalid IPs
  * Targeted services

    * IP
    * Broadcast IP
    * FQDN
    * Domain
  * Large abnormal outbound traffic observed?

    * Yes â†’ indicator of reflection/amplification attack from our infrastructures
* Assess discriminating factors

  * Identify one or more discriminants of the denial of service
  * Protocol â€“ Layer 3 (OSI)

    * Diagnosis: equipment logs or packet capture
    * ICMP flood: Ping flood, Smurf, Ping of Death
  * Protocol â€“ Layer 4

    * Diagnosis: logs or packet capture, DNS
    * Attacks: TCP SYN flood, UDP flood, DNS flood, DNS amplification, SNMP/NTP/other floods
  * TLS â€“ Layer 6

    * Diagnosis: logs or packet capture
    * Attacks: malformed SSL/TLS causing CPU overload
  * Application â€“ Layer 7

    * Diagnosis: logs or packet capture
    * HTTP(S) flood: headers
    * GET flood, POST flood, recurring User-Agent, other recurring headers
    * Abnormal requests:

      * Volume causing CPU/Memory/Storage exhaustion
      * Very long requests blocking sessions (netstat or firewall)
      * Exploitation of application weaknesses
      * Protocol bugs: HTTP/1.1 attack, HTTP/2 standard, HTTP/2 Rapid Reset
      * Misconfigured infrastructure or resource-intensive WAF rules

---

* See reflex sheet for the conclusion table
* List of IoA/IoC: IPs/blocks/AS, JA3/JA4, User-Agent, headers, ports, flags, FQDN
* Evidence and captures: log extracts (equipment 1â€“8, DNS 9), PCAP, timestamp, method
* All gathered information added to the incident (activities, observables)

### ğŸ“Œ Actions

For each identified impacted critical activity:

* Is there a business continuity procedure in normal mode?
* Is there a procedure for degraded mode operation?

tasks.title: Measure 2 â€“ Assess the affected IT scope
tasks.description:
### ğŸ¯ Objective

Describe **vectors**, **targets**, and **intensity**.

---

### ğŸ“Œ Actions

* Map the denial-of-service traffic chain

  * Map the devices and machines involved in the traffic chain from the origin of requests (source IPs) to the destination (destination IPs)
  * Identify the targeted service(s) with the destination IPs of the attack
  * Map all IT dependencies (devices and machines) of the targeted services
* Identify administration means and responsible personnel

  * Identify administration methods for these devices and machines
  * Identify who is responsible for administering these devices and machines
* Identify failing elements in the chain (IT impact)

  * ISP scope

    * ISP link
    * Internet access router
  * Hosting provider scope

    * Firewall, Web Application Firewall, Load balancer

      * Resource saturation (CPU, memory, disk)
      * Network unavailability: ping loss, state or session table saturation
      * Other alerts in the admin interface
  * Hosting resources

    * Hypervisor, Front-end or application servers, Database servers

      * Resource saturation (CPU, memory, disk)
      * Application, process, service, or account blocked (monitored via admin interface or application logs)
      * Network unavailability of the equipment in monitoring tools (e.g. ping loss)
  * Dependent services scope

    * DNS service
    * CDN
    * Third-party components

---

### âœ… Deliverables

* Scope assessed
* List of failing elements documented in the **activities** of this task

tasks.title: Measure 1 â€“ Confirm the network denial-of-service incident
tasks.description:
### ğŸ¯ Objective

Rule out a **production** incident and confirm a **DoS/DDoS**.

### ğŸ“Œ Actions

* Rule out a production incident

  * Recent operational or security update (MCO/MCS)
  * Recent configuration change
  * Issue observed in a similar environment
  * Expired license, contract, certificate, or domain name
  * Service account deleted, disabled, blocked, or with changed/expired password
* Assess signals on the information system

  * Security monitoring

    * SOC or NOC detection
    * Alerts: firewalls, web application firewalls, reverse proxies, network switches, NIPS/NIDS
  * Production monitoring

    * Services unavailable or slow
    * Resources saturated in server consoles
    * Network traffic volume deviating from the usual baseline
* Confirm the network nature of the incident

  * Saturation of ISP links
  * Abnormally high number of requests in network or application logs
  * Recurrent network requests

### âœ… Deliverables

* Initial qualification conclusions
* All gathered information added to the incident (activities, observables)

tasks.title: Measure 4 â€“ Assess the incidentâ€™s impact
tasks.description:
### ğŸ¯ Objective

Assess the incidentâ€™s impact (Business, Regulatory, Financial, Third parties, Containment)

---

### ğŸ“Œ Actions

* **Business**: identify impacted activities (internal/external), application dependencies, critical services, impact on reputation/finances/people
* **Regulatory**: check obligations (OSE, OIV, GDPR, CNIL)
* **Financial**: assess direct costs (billed services, VMs, etc.)
* **Third parties**: verify if our infrastructures cause external impact (reflection/amplification)
* **Containment**: measure the effects of actions already taken (traffic cut/filtered, business impacts)

---

### âœ… Deliverables

* Summary: impacted business chains, regulatory impacts, financial impacts, third-party impacts, and effects of containment measures
* All gathered information added to the incident (activities, observables)
